definition: palace/temple/castration (as corporal punishment)/first note in pentatonic scale

sentences.english: Edgars says it is beautiful palace - but that “Riga is better”.
sentences.chinese: 埃德加说这是一座美丽的宫殿，但是里加更美丽。

sentences.english: 13 consider well her ramparts, view her citadels, that you may tell of them to the next generation.
sentences.chinese: 细看他的外郭，察看他的宫殿，为要传说到后代。

sentences.english: My gramma, she owns the Pink Palace.
sentences.chinese: 我的奶奶，她拥有这个粉色宫殿。
金碧辉煌的宫殿使她赞叹不已。

sentences.english: The palace contains many art treasures.
sentences.chinese: 这宫殿里藏有许多艺术瑰宝。

sentences.english: Here was a big round 2-floor architecture in the middle of the palace.
sentences.chinese: 这是宫殿中央的一个巨大两层楼的圆形建筑。

sentences.english: The Emperor Mingdi of the Eastern Han Dynasty dreamt of a golden man flying over the palace.
sentences.chinese: 东汉明帝梦见一个金人飞行于宫殿之上。

sentences.english: It's a palace with a huge marble portico.
sentences.chinese: 这是一个建有巨大的大理石柱廊的宫殿。

sentences.english: The magnificent Ming and Qing palaces' pillars are red and the tiles are yellow.
sentences.chinese: 这座宏伟的明，清时代的宫殿是红柱黄瓦。

sentences.english: The Hall is a beautiful building in the style of a Chinese palace.
sentences.chinese: 纪念堂是一座中国宫殿形式的美丽建筑。

sentences.english: The entire palace fell asleep, along with the Princess.
sentences.chinese: 整个宫殿都和公主一起睡着了。

sentences.english: She is depicted in a room within an opulent palace.
sentences.chinese: 她被描绘成住在一座豪华宫殿的房间中。

sentences.english: I'm going to go guard the Queen and stand outside the palace in my tunic.
sentences.chinese: 我要去守卫女王，穿着制服站在宫殿外。

sentences.english: Nausikaa leads Odysseus to the palace of her father.
sentences.chinese: 瑙西卡带着奥德修斯去她父亲的宫殿。

sentences.english: It′s just like a treasure palace.
sentences.chinese: 这里几乎像一个至宝宫殿。

definition: main hall of a Buddhist temple
(literary) halls (of a palace or a temple)
main hall of a Buddhist temple
underground palace (as part of imperial tomb)
gold and jade in glorious splendor (idiom)/fig. a dazzling sight (e.g. royal palace)
